originalText.text: Friendly staff. Great service. The level of customer service provided by Hertz made this trip so much more wonderful than it could have been altogether otherwise. I recommend booking trips in the morning so you don’t have any issues with picking up or dropping off.

text.text: Friendly staff. Great service. The level of customer service provided by Hertz made this trip so much more wonderful than it could have been altogether otherwise. I recommend booking trips in the morning so you don’t have any issues with picking up or dropping off.

originalText.text: made a reservation months ago, paid money, get to the location and there’s a sign up that says that they’re closed for construction. how could you not inform your customers who have paid and reserved a car, that the location where the appointment is is closed…. unreal

text.text: made a reservation months ago, paid money, get to the location and there’s a sign up that says that they’re closed for construction. how could you not inform your customers who have paid and reserved a car, that the location where the appointment is is closed…. unreal

originalText.text:
Ordinarily, I wouldn't take the time to write about a poor customer experience, but this has been so far above and beyond the worst experience I've ever had renting a vehicle that I felt a moral obligation to warn as many as possible to avoid this company.

It started on June 29th when I was supposed to pick up my rental car from the Greenwich Village location on Morton St. Earlier that week my Grandfather had passed away and I reserved a vehicle for a 3pm pick-up to drive north for his funeral service. Upon arriving at the rental location at 3pm, I found the lights turned off and doors locked bringing me to my first question:

Why are customers allowed to reserve rental vehicles up to the exact minute a location closes?

Surely, I'm not the first customer this has happened to and there must be a system in place? This is when the nefarious side of Hertz began to reveal itself. The only solution to their failure was for me to cancel my reservation and book a new one. Now under certain circumstances, I could see a last-minute reservation at another location coming close to the same price but last-minute rentals before the 4th of July were thousands of dollars more than my original contract.

Upon speaking with the customer service team, the best they could do was apply discount codes to a reservation an hour away in New Jersey (but not to worry, they assured me, I'd be able to return the vehicle to the original location). What they failed to mention was that the only way that would be possible was if I paid an additional $356 "drop fee"... you must be joking.

Hertz has never been a beacon of customer service but this nightmare of a rental process has deterred me from ever renting with this company again. I would strongly advise all to reconsider renting a vehicle from this location or Hertz in general.

originalText.text: Take note this outlet is closed, yet they still allowed you to book a car pick up from this location.

text.text: Take note this outlet is closed, yet they still allowed you to book a car pick up from this location.

originalText.text: I originally booked the car to be picked up at 1030 and returned at 8 pm.  Before I got the car, I told the man at the counter that I needed it past 8 am.  He said I could return it the next morning before 1030 for the same price.  I returned the car at 959 and received a late return fee.  I contacted Hertz and they refused to issue me a refund.  This is very deceiving
